metadata.dc:title: Democratisation of the relationship between nurse/citizen: the informed consent
metadata.dc:description: From the beginning of time, the people (population) and those individuals who have been responsiblefor healthcare have established some relations that, in general, have been vertical indifferent degrees, according to the historical evolution and different professions. With the recognitionof human rights and the democratisation of social relations, this trend is also startingto have an effect among healthcare professionals and the users. It is collected in the bioethicalprinciple of autonomy and reflected in the informed consent.• Nursing professionals, given the role that they have assumed now, must re-examine their relationshipwith the users and the process of information that the users need in order to reachwell informed and free decisions regarding their health
